Article Title: “It’s going to be hard for her”: Patrick Mahomes reveals why Travis Kelce's girlfriend Taylor Swift should not perform at the Super Bowl
Article Text:
Image via Imagn Images

Patrick Mahomes on why Taylor Swift should sit out the big game

The Kansas City Chiefs and Philadelphia Eagles are warming up for the second Super Bowl in three years with minimal rancor. "Bad Blood" from Taylor Swift's 1989 album may make it to the halftime show, and Kendrick Lamar has been announced as the headliner with SZA as a special guest. Lamar, who won five Grammys for his diss track "Not Like Us," is set to perform.Some fans are eagerly awaiting the collaboration between Lamar and Swift, whom they have been close to for more than a decade. However, during Super Bowl opening night, Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes dispelled these rumors, saying that Swift will not be performing at Caesars Superdome.The major 2025 TV event will be Super Bowl LIX, with the Philadelphia Eagles against the Kansas City Chiefs. Fans will be able to enjoy a halftime show headlined by Kendrick Lamar, but Taylor Swift, who is a Chiefs fan, will not perform. Patrick Mahomes predicts that the event will be entertaining, especially with Lamar's electric performance and Swift's support for the Chiefs.Taylor Swift is a very entertaining pop star with the voice, stage presence, and song catalog to headline a Super Bowl halftime show. But Kansas City quarterback Patrick Mahomes thinks it would be perfect for her to sit out the game. Mahomes spoke to the media during SB Opening Night at New Orleans' Superdome, sharing his humorous take.“Everyone wants to see a Taylor Swift halftime show, can you help us make that happen?” One reporter asked Mahomes. “As long as Trav’s playing and we’re in the Super Bowl, it’s going to be hard for her to do the halftime show,” Mahomes said. “So hopefully Trav keeps playing and we keep making it to the Super Bowl.”Swift has become a regular at games, cheering on her boyfriend Travis Kelce from a luxurious suite while wearing a Chiefs jacket. Ideally, she wants to stay a spectator to focus on her energy, as Kelce would miss the performance due to his teammates in the locker room during halftime.Patrick Mahomes can be funny about what Taylor Swift is doing at the Super Bowl, but fans have to know that Kendrick Lamar does appear on a track for a remixed version of Swift's 2015 single "Bad Blood." The idea of a potential team-up at the Super Bowl is intriguing, but the chances of it happening are probably slim.Also Read: Will Taylor Swift's dad ditch Travis Kelce and support the Eagles during the Super Bowl LIX? The Chiefs’ TE gave a head-turning answer Super Bowl LIX is set for an exciting game and an excellent halftime show. Taylor Swift is expected to sit out, but there's a chance she could surprise fans and reunite with K-Dot for a quick performance. Tune in on February 9 at 6:30 p.m. ET/3:30 p.m. PT on Fox.
Article Summary: Patrick Mahomes says Taylor Swift will not perform at Super Bowl LIX. Kendrick Lamar has been announced as the headliner with SZA as a special guest. Mahomes predicts that the event will be entertaining, especially with Lamar's electric performance and Swift's support for the Chiefs.

Article Title: “It’s golden / Like daylight”: Fans believe Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift coordinated their outfits on the Grammys' day to match one of her love songs
Article Text:

Travis Kelce donned his own Taylor Swift Easter eggs on Grammys Night

The Kansas City Chiefs and the Philadelphia Eagles made their way into New Orleans to play Super Bowl LIX , with the Kansas City Chiefs tight end, Travis Kelce sporting a vintage look with a special tribute - that is a white and purple Super Bowl XXXI cap. Well, an NFL star indeed did take a leaf from the girlfriend's book because both the stars love vintage clothes. And so do they both love special messages and tributes in what they wear.Travis Kelce donned a cap to New Orleans for Super Bowl XXXI, which was hosted by New Orleans and played in the Superdome in 1997. The Green Bay Packers beat the Patriots 35-21. The game is also important for Chiefs head coach Andy Reid, who won his first Super Bowl as an assistant coach in 1997.Taylor Swift honored Travis Kelce by attending 2025 Grammys in a Kansas City Chiefs-red Vivienne Westwood corset minidress, while Kelce was unable to appear in person to prepare for Super Bowl and donned his golden outfit. Kelce, who will be watching the Super Bowl in New Orleans, wore a Grammys-gold Palm Angels tracksuit, Versace sunglasses, a Louis Vuitton bag, and a vintage Super Bowl baseball cap, a nod to the 1997 game played in the city.Fans believe the couple coordinated their outfits to be an Easter egg of her "Daylight" lyrics, “I once believed love would be (Burnin’ red) / But it’s golden / Like daylight, like daylight / Like daylight, daylight.” Swift’s Grammys look had another Kelce Easter egg, a “T” chain hanging off her thigh.The initial charm appears to be a reference to her Reputation song "Call It What You Want." Swift sings, “I want to wear his initial / On a chain ’round my neck, chain ’round my neck / Not because he owns me / But ’cause he really knows me.”Swift initially referenced her then-boyfriend Joe Alwyn in her song, but she later changed it to reflect her current relationship with Kelce during her Eras Tour, showcasing her ability to adapt her music to her current life. The lyric of “Karma” from Midnights originally went: “Karma is the guy on the screen / Coming straight home to me.” But she started singing it as: “Karma is the guy on the Chiefs / Coming straight home to me.”Also Read: "He's written 'mine' on my upper thigh": Why is there a talk about Taylor Swift's ‘T’ charm? Fans believe it's a nod to Travis Kelce While Kelce prepares for the Super Bowl, Swift has "liked" a post from the Chiefs' official Instagram account showcasing her boyfriend's arrival in New Orleans on February 2. She is expected to attend and cheer him on, as she did last year, with a star-studded entourage including Blake Lively, Ice Spice, Lana Del Rey, Miles Teller, Keleigh Teller, Swift's parents, and brother Austin Swift.

Article Title: Voice assistants, virtual try-ons, and AI: Dubai’s new retail reality
Article Text:
Personalisation at the forefront

AppsFlyer

AI meets telecom retail

e& UAE Ease Store

Revolutionising operations

Pioneering a new era of retail

Click

for more on Business in Dubai.

This article is contributed by Sindhu Kashyap

It is a part of a featured content series on Business in Dubai.

Disclaimer - This article has been produced by the Times Internet's Spotlight team

Dubai has been long celebrated as a global retail haven, and is now making waves in the world of artificial intelligence (AI). Known for its expansive malls and top-tier brands, the city is seamlessly blending tradition with technology to reshape how consumers shop, interact with brands, and experience retail.Behind the luxurious displays and bespoke offerings lies a layer of AI-powered innovation that’s redefining personalisation, streamlining operations, and enhancing customer satisfaction. From designing jewellery to curating personalised shopping experiences, Dubai is setting new benchmarks in the global retail landscape.In today’s retail environment, customers seek experiences that resonate on a personal level. AI has emerged as the linchpin of this transformation. Amreen Iqbal , Founder and Creative Director of Piece of You, a custom jewellery brand in Dubai, emphasises the depth of this shift: “It’s about understanding the customer deeper—what they want, how they want it, and how we can make it special and unique to each customer. AI helps us do that.”Her brand employs AI-powered tools to enable customers to design unique jewellery pieces through virtual try-ons and bespoke customisation. “The ability to personalise jewellery at this level was unthinkable a few years ago. Now, with AI, it’s a reality,” she adds.Similarly, global e-commerce innovations have gained traction in Dubai. Sue Azari , an e-commerce consultant at, notes, “AI enables highly customised and intuitive customer experiences.”She cites Zalando’s AI-powered chatbot as a perfect example: “If you need an outfit for a Christmas party, you simply describe your needs, and the chatbot curates a complete look, including accessories. It’s like having a personal shopper who knows your wardrobe.”In the beauty sector, major players like Sephora are redefining the customer journey with AI. Through augmented reality (AR) and AI features, their app enables users to virtually try on products like lipstick shades while integrating seamless social sharing options. Azari explains, “It’s about creating an experience, not just a transaction.”Walid BenOthman, Managing Director at Bitpanda, in Dubai, added that AI-driven personalisation has created a 25% improvement in customer satisfaction, revenue, or cost reduction. “Additionally, AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants provide 24/7 customer support, improving engagement and customer satisfaction.”He explained AI has made it easy to bring in hyper-personalised advertisements by analysing customer behaviour, creating more effective campaigns and higher conversion rates.Adding to Dubai’s retail innovation is the launch of theat Dubai Mall, as reported. The AI-powered store enhances the telecom retail experience by offering an array of cutting-edge features. Using AI and robotics, customers can explore products, make payments, and even collect purchases from automated lockers.The store is equipped with advanced facial recognition technology, enabling personalised interactions and tailored product suggestions. It epitomises Dubai’s vision to merge physical retail with AI-driven efficiency. As highlighted in several news reports, this initiative underscores Dubai’s commitment to revolutionising traditional retail through technology. report by GoGlobe has highlighted that Dubai AI’s impact extends beyond personalisation, revolutionising how brands market their products. Generative AI (genAI) has emerged as a game-changer, enabling dynamic, hyper-personalised advertisements and streamlining content creation.“AI doesn’t just generate content; it analyses performance metrics to refine strategies in real-time. It saves marketers countless hours and ensures campaigns are efficient and impactful,” explains Azari.Iqbal highlights AI’s ability to enhance marketing precision through predictive analytics, helping businesses target audiences with unparalleled accuracy. From creating dynamic ads to optimising email campaigns, AI ensures that every touchpoint is relevant and impactful.At Amazon, for instance, AI-generated product descriptions have not only increased efficiency but also improved SEO performance and consistency. “This is not just automation; it’s about making marketing smarter and more strategic,” notes Azari.While customers benefit from AI-driven personalisation, its operational applications are equally transformative. Gavin Jackson, Senior Vice President of Data and AI at Endava, highlights the role of AI in inventory management: “AI has turned inventory management into a science. Retailers can now accurately predict demand, ensuring shelves are stocked without over-ordering. It’s a win for both businesses and consumers.”Jackson explains that AI-powered systems can even trigger additional production when products start selling out, ensuring businesses never miss a sales opportunity. Logistics and supply chains are also undergoing an AI-driven revolution, with systems optimising delivery routes, warehouse layouts, and energy consumption. “It’s about creating an interconnected ecosystem where every touchpoint is as efficient as possible,” he adds.Dubai’s embrace of AI is propelling the city into a new era of retail excellence. By integrating advanced technologies across personalisation, marketing, and operations, the city is not only enhancing customer experiences but also setting a global standard for innovation in retail.As Iqbal aptly puts it, “The ability to create personalised, meaningful experiences isn’t just a luxury—it’s a necessity. And AI makes it possible.”Dubai’s commitment to leveraging AI ensures that its reputation as a global retail hub remains stronger than ever, firmly rooted in innovation and customer-centricity.
Article Summary: Dubai is blending tradition with technology to reshape how consumers shop, interact with brands, and experience retail. From designing jewellery to curating personalised shopping experiences, Dubai is setting new benchmarks in the global retail landscape. Generative AI has emerged as a game-changer, enabling dynamic, hyper-personalised advertisements.

Article Title: Princess Diana: Prince Harry reveals contacting late mother Princess Diana through psychic in his memoir 'Spare'
Article Text:
File photo: Princess Diana with young William and Harry (Picture credit: X)

Prince Harry has shared a personal story about contacting his late mother, Princess Diana, through a psychic. In his memoir, Spare, the Duke of Sussex talks about reaching out to a medium with supernatural abilities to communicate with Diana, who passed away in a car accident in Paris in 1997, just before his 13th birthday, The Mirror reported.The Duke received a message from his mother through the psychic, who told him, "You're living the life she wanted for you." Harry, now 40, says that the medium also told him his mother was with him "right now," which made his neck warm and his eyes fill with tears.The psychic shared that Diana knew Harry was "looking for clarity" and "feels your confusion." She added that Diana understood Harry had "so many questions" and that answers would come in time.Another anecdote involved Prince Harry’s son, Archie. The psychic reportedly described how Diana’s spirit witnessed Archie accidentally breaking a Christmas tree ornament shaped like Queen Elizabeth. When asked, Harry admitted the incident had occurred, adding that Archie had attempted to fix the ornament.The medium suggested Diana found humour in the situation, delighting in the antics of her grandson she never had the chance to meet.In Spare, Prince Harry also recounts an extraordinary encounter with a leopard during a trip to Botswana with his brother, Prince William. He interpreted the animal’s presence as a comforting sign from his late mother, suggesting that "everything will be fine." However, the experience was not without fear, as he briefly worried the leopard might attack.Harry has been candid about the psychological toll of losing Diana so young. As reported by The Mirror, he disclosed a haunting period after her death when he entertained the possibility that she had staged her demise. His anguish led him to repeatedly drive through the Paris tunnel where Diana’s life was cut short, attempting to make sense of the tragedy.
Article Summary: Prince Harry has shared a personal story about contacting his late mother, Princess Diana, through a psychic. In his memoir, Spare, the Duke of Sussex talks about reaching out to a medium with supernatural abilities to communicate with Diana. Diana passed away in a car accident in Paris in 1997, just before his 13th birthday.

Article Title: Marriage Proposal Goes Wrong After Girlfriend Eats Gold Ring Hidden in Cake
Article Text: A Chinese man's romantic proposal took an unexpected and humorous turn when his girlfriend unknowingly ate the engagement ring hidden in a cake, sparking laughter.The amusing incident was shared by a netizen surnamed Liu from Guang'an, Sichuan province, on a popular social media platform. Her post, titled "attention, all men: Never hide a proposal ring in food!" quickly gained traction, entertaining thousands.Liu recounted that after arriving home hungry one evening, she eagerly devoured a taro and meat floss cake her boyfriend had prepared. "The cake was covered with a thick layer of meat floss, so I was just chewing it until I bit into something hard. I immediately spat it out," she explained.Initially assuming it was a bad quality, Liu prepared to complain to the bakery. However, her boyfriend, noticing her confusion, examined the foreign object. After wiping it clean, he revealed, "Honey, I think this might be the ring I was going to propose to you with."Caught off guard, Liu thought he was joking but soon realised it was indeed a gold ring. In the awkward moment that followed, her boyfriend hesitantly asked, "What do we do now? Should I still kneel?" Liu, unable to contain her laughter, encouraged him to proceed with the proposal, which she accepted.Later, Liu described the event as the "most dramatic scene of the year" and advised against using food as a proposal medium. "This will be a memory we will never forget, but this proposal method is a bit risky. I hope others take our story as a caution and avoid trying it themselves," she told the Xiaoxiang Morning Herald.The video of the incident went viral, with netizens flooding the post with humorous reactions. One user joked, "The strength of her bite is no less than that of an adult cheetah." Another congratulated the couple, adding, "Especially to this bride-to-be for her strong teeth!"A third commenter playfully noted, "This must be what is called 'a couple's love can break gold!'" while another advised, "This will be something you'll laugh about even when you're old and grey! But seriously, guys, no more hiding rings in food. Imagine if it were a diamond that could easily break someone's tooth!"
Article Summary: A Chinese man's romantic proposal took an unexpected and humorous turn when his girlfriend unknowingly ate the engagement ring hidden in a cake. The amusing incident was shared by a netizen surnamed Liu from Guang'an, Sichuan province, on a popular social media platform.

The Unified Payments Interface (UPI) is a real-time payment system created by the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), which operates under the regulatory oversight of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). Leveraging the IMPS infrastructure , UPI enables immediate transfer of funds between the bank accounts of any two parties.The primary purpose of UPI is to facilitate convenient and safe money transfers between bank accounts.It achieves this by integrating multiple bank accounts into a single mobile application, enabling effortless transfers and merchant payments from a unified platform.Users can initiate payments using various identifiers such as UPI ID, UPI Number, Account number, and Indian Financial System Code (IFSC). Payment security adheres to RBI regulations, employing a 1-click 2-factor authentication method, with the UPI PIN serving as the second authentication factor.With digital payments becoming increasingly popular, we take a look at some commonly asked questions UPI consumers have in mind with regards to linking their bank accounts to UPI and more:If your bank account isn't being found when attempting to link it with UPI, ensure that the mobile number associated with your bank account matches the one verified in any UPI App. If they don't match, your bank accounts may not be fetched by the UPI platform.No, all payments on UPI are instant and available 24/7, irrespective of your bank's working hours.Initially, only bank accounts could be linked, but now PPI Wallets can also be linked to UPI.Yes, you can link multiple bank accounts to the same virtual address, depending on the features offered by the respective PSPs.UPI is a feature of the NPCI, a regulated entity by RBI. It retrieves account details linked with your mobile number in a masked manner over secure banking networks. Your information is not stored or used by UPI.You can set your UPI PIN through any PSP app using your debit card details.Yes, you can use more than one UPI application on the same mobile device and link both the same and different bank accounts.

New RuPay credit card rules : The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has unveiled updates for RuPay Credit Card holders on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) platform. These include EMI options, credit account bill payments, instalment payments, and limit management. Banks and card issuers have been asked to enable these features by May 31, 2024.As per an ET report, NPCI announced on March 29, that RuPay credit cards and pre-approved credit lines can now be linked on UPI, facilitating secure payment transactions. This integration aims to offer users enhanced convenience in using their credit cards and pre-approved credit lines. Here are the details of the new features introduced:Users can now apply for an EMI facility directly through the UPI app for their linked credit accounts . Once the terms and conditions are approved, users can complete the process by entering their UPI PIN for authentication.The feature will allow users to convert their previous credit card purchases into monthly instalments (EMI) using the linked UPI app based on their transaction history.The existing EMIs will be displayed in the appropriate section of the UPI app. Users will not be allowed to modify or cancel the EMIs, except in cases of early repayment, as it's treated like a loan according to the issuer company's policies.This feature enables users to use the UPI app for making one-time payments or setting up UPI AutoPay to settle outstanding credit card bills and instalment payments for both themselves and other users.NPCI release further stated that, “To do this, Payer PSP shall create UPI ID for receiving credit account bill/ instalment payment . UPI App shall provide a view for the user to access the details of linked credit card outstanding bill/ credit line instalment details (minimum amount due, total amount due, bill due date etc). Moreover, this feature allows the issuing bank to initially set lower credit limits and then adjust them based on the user's spending behaviour.It's important to note that this functionality enables changes to credit limits via UPI apps, which may be general or specific for a temporary period, requiring explicit consent from the user by entering their UPI PIN.

This new facility, named "joint declaration," simplifies the process for EPF members, eliminating the need for offline submissions.The new facility is different from the joint declaration form required by EPF members under Para 26(6) of the EPF scheme .This form is mandatory for those wishing to contribute more to their EPF account when their basic salary exceeds the statutory limit (currently Rs 15,000 per month).The new facility, also known as joint declaration, allows members to update their KYC details online instead of through offline methods. Article Title: Raising Financially Savvy Kids: Age-Appropriate Money Management Education for the Next Generation
Article Text:
By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults.

By Tvisha Tuli, Content Creator

Start Early with a Modest Allowance: Consider providing your children with a small monthly allowance that introduces them to the concept of budgeting and the value of earning money through contributing to household chores. Make Saving a Game: Start small, perhaps with a reward system tied to their favorite pastimes. By linking their efforts to tangible rewards, such as completing chores to play video games, the habit of budgeting gets cultivated and seamlessly transitions into saving real money. Teach Budgeting Using the 50:30:20 Rule: This is a simple yet powerful tool that teaches them to allocate 50% of their money for needs, like food and clothing, 30% for wants, such as toys or treats, and 20% for savings . This approach helps children discern between needs and wants while cultivating patience in their financial journey. Make Learning Fun with Board Games: Incorporate board games like Monopoly, Game of Life, etc., into family game nights. These games not only entertain but also impart valuable lessons on financial planning, decision-making, and the significance of saving and investing. Explore Age-Appropriate Books: Invest in age-appropriate books that emphasize the importance of saving and financial responsibility, from colorful stories for younger audiences to more sophisticated guides for older children. Encourage Smart Shopping : Take children along when shopping and show them how to compare prices. Teach them to look for good deals and bargains, instilling resourcefulness and a strong sense of stewardship.

If the world is a giant machine, money is the fuel that keeps it running smoothly. From buying groceries to raising funds, money is at the heart of almost everything we do. That's why understanding how money works is so crucial in today's world.However, in the schoolyard of life, the curriculum often skips over the ABCs of financial literacy .Hence, it becomes imperative for parents to step into the role of headmasters, ensuring their children are equipped with more than just algebra and history. Just as parents meticulously prepare their children for exams and extracurricular activities, they must also take the reins in imparting essential lessons on money management . When one knows how to budget, save, and spend wisely, one is better prepared to handle everyday situations like paying bills, or even planning for big goals like college or a career.Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest; it's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. From an early age, children absorb lessons about money, whether consciously or unconsciously, from their surroundings. Therefore, it's incumbent upon parents, educators, and policymakers to ensure that these lessons are deliberate and conducive to financial well-being. Just as we teach children the alphabet before they can read, we should introduce basic financial concepts before they encounter their first paycheck.Here are practical steps that parents can incorporate into their child-rearing journey to ensure a lifetime of sound financial habits:By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults, capable of making informed decisions, pursuing their dreams, and contributing meaningfully to society. As these empowered individuals enter the workforce and engage in economic activities, they will not only secure their financial well-being but cultivate a stronger, more resilient economy for generations to come.
Article Summary: Financial literacy isn't just about balancing a checkbook or understanding compound interest. It's about fostering a mindset of prudence, responsibility, and foresight. By instilling financial literacy in children today, we are sowing the seeds for a future where they will grow into financially confident adults.

Key components of hallmark on gold jewellery



Gold, silver hallmarking : Gold and silver jewllery have long been treasured for their beauty and value. However, ensuring their purity and authenticity is important, especially in a market prone to fraudulent practices. This is where the hallmarking scheme comes into play. Here’s what you need to know about hallmarking charges and its procedures:Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver.It serves as a guarantee of their purity or fineness. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820, according to an ET report.Hallmarking charges are applied per article, regardless of its weight. For gold articles, the charge is Rs 45 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 200 for a consignment. Similarly, for silver articles, the charge is Rs 35 per article, with a minimum charge of Rs 150 for a consignment. It's important to note that additional taxes and levies may apply.A consignment refers to a collection of articles with the same fineness, from which a sample is drawn and assayed for compliance. Different lots may exist within a consignment.Anyone can have their hallmarked jewellery tested for purity at an A&H centre by paying a testing fee of Rs. 200 (for testing using the fire assay method as per IS 1418). These centres must be recognized by the BIS. The list of recognized A&H centres is available on the BIS website under the hallmarking section.The primary objective of hallmarking is to safeguard consumers from counterfeit products. To achieve this, the Indian government made hallmarking mandatory for gold jewellery from June 16, 2021. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification ( HUID ) number.If you bought gold jewellery on or before June 30, 2021, it may have old hallmarking signs. These signs include the purity/fineness mark and the BIS emblem, along with two additional indications: the jeweller's identification number and the assay centre's mark/number.However, starting July 1, 2021, these two indications were replaced with a unique alphanumeric HUID code. The hallmark remains valid for the lifetime of the jewellery, and consumers can sell old jewellery, whether hallmarked or un-hallmarked, to jewellers.The HUID, or hallmark Unique Identification number, is a key component of hallmarking in gold jewellery. It's a unique six-digit alphanumeric code assigned to each hallmarked item, allowing for traceability. Customers can verify the HUID number using the 'Verify HUID' feature in the BIS Care App.Since the introduction of the HUID on July 1, 2021, the hallmark on gold jewellery consists of three marks: the BIS logo, the purity of the article in caratage and fineness, and a unique six-digit alphanumeric HUID number.
Article Summary: Hallmarking is the process of accurately determining and officially recording the proportionate content of precious metals in articles, such as gold and silver. In India, hallmarking is governed by stringent standards outlined in IS 15820. Since April 1, 2023, jewellers are prohibited from selling any gold jewellery without a 6-digit Hallmark Unique Identification number.

The Gorilla Glass Armor 2 on the Galaxy S25 Ultra is scratch resistant and it also provides anti-reflective glass ceramic cover the the smartphone. The design is both durable and elegant, with a slimmer and lighter build compared to its predecessors. The phone now features smoother, rounded corners, making it more comfortable to hold. The ride side of the smartphone houses the volume rockers and the power button. Apart from waking up the smartphone, the users can also use the power button to activate Google Gemini. The bottom part of the smartphone houses the USB Type C charging case, the slot for S Pen and the SIM card tray. The front is dominated by a 6.9-inch AMOLED display and the rear of the smartphone houses the quad-camera setup placed neatly in the top right corner. The smartphone also comes with IP68 rating which makes it resistant to dust and water. The overall build of Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra exudes sophistication, maintaining its status as a flagship device.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra sports a 6.9-inch Quad HD+ Infinity-O-Edge AMOLED display. The display on the smartphone offers a variable refresh rate of up to 120Hz. The screen is protected with a coating of Corning Gorilla Armor 2 glass which makes it resistant to scratches. We really liked the display on the flagship Samsung smartphone. It offers a crisp resolution, smooth 120Hz adaptive refresh rate, and enhanced Vision Booster for vivid outdoor viewing. Samsung has further enhanced brightness levels, making it easy to view even under harsh sunlight. The colour accuracy and HDR performance ensure vibrant visuals, whether you're gaming or streaming videos.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is powered by Android’s most powerful and advanced chipset – Snapdragon 8 Elite. The smartphone comes in three variants – 12GB+256GB, 12GB+512GB and 12GB + 1TB. The smartphone performed well during our initial testing and we didn’t face any lag. We had a smooth experience during multitasking and gaming. Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra is backed by a 5,000 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support. The smartphone also supports Qi wireless charging. Samsung claims that the smartphone can charge from 0to 65% in just 30 minutes. However, we are yet to test this functionality and the battery backup of the smartphone. The dual SIM smartphone comes equipped with an in- display fingerprint sensor and sports a quad rear camera setup.Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra runs Android 15 operating system topped with the company's own layer of One UI 7. Samsung has also confirmed that the Galaxy S25 Ultra will get seven years of OS and security updates. Coming to One UI 7, the AI integration in One UI 7 feels more intuitive, with features like natural language search and context-aware multitasking. The AI features of the OS come with a significant new look, based on a new notification system that streamlines communication with easy access from the device's lock screen. It includes Now Bar, which highlights relevant activities across various features like Interpreter, Music, Recording, Stopwatch and more. One UI 7 also reduces visual clutter and offers a simplified homescreen, redesigned One UI widgets, and lock screen which enhances the user experience. We will talk more about the software in our detailed review of the smartphone.Same as its predecessor, the Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra also sports a quad rear camera setup. The rear camera consists of 200MP main camera with f/1.7 aperture, 50MP ultra wide sensor with f/1.9 aperture, 10MP telephoto lens with 3x optical zoom and f/2.4 aperture and 50MP periscope telephoto lens for 5x optical zoom and f/3.4 aperture. Front houses a 12MP selfie camera with f/2.2 aperture. The camera delivered some really impressive results during our initial testing. The primary sensor on the Galaxy S25 Ultra manages to capture incredible detail and dynamic range. The AI enhancements bring sharper portraits and more accurate colour reproduction. Features like depth-of-field control and Galaxy Log enhance creative possibilities and help users do much more with the camera. Also, the redesigned camera UX allows more intuitive control over advanced settings. Camera buttons, controls, and modes have been reorganised to make it easier to find the features you need and to give you a clearer preview of the picture you’re taking or the video you're recording. For the detailed camera analysis, you will have to wait for our detailed review.Overall, the Galaxy S25 Ultra feels like a refined iteration of an already impressive formula. Its snappier UI, AI enhancements, and polished design make it a top contender in the flagship smartphone segment. The smartphone offers a sleek design and all the high-end and powerful specifications. But will that be enough? Wait for our detailed review to find out more.

Article Title: Netflix removes actress Karla Sofia Gascon from posters of Oscar nominated movie Emilia Perez
Article Text:
Gascon faces backlash over offensive tweets

Netflix has reportedly removed transgender actress Karla Sofia Gascon from promotional materials for its Oscar-nominated film Emilia Perez. This comes a month ahead of the 97th Academy Awards. Several users on social media platforms like X/Twitter and Reddit noted that the streamer appeared to be downplaying Gascon's presence in their Oscar campaign for the film.“Karla Sofia Gascon has been completely erased from the latest Oscars ' For Your Consideration ' ad for Emilia Perez. I wonder why!??,” wrote a user on X, sharing an image of promotional material of the film on Netflix.“New Netflix FYC poster for Emilia Perez without Karla on it oh it’s OVER lmaooo,” wrote another user on X.Gascon, 52, made history as the first openly transgender actress to receive a Best Actress nomination for her portrayal of the film’s titular character. However, promotional materials for the 'For Your Consideration' (FYC) campaign appeared to center on Best Supporting Actress nominee Zoe Saldana, 46. Saldana, who earned her first career Oscar nomination for playing Rita in the Spanish-language film, is widely considered the frontrunner for the award.In a related news, Gascon has faced intense backlash over offensive tweets she posted in the past five years, with remarks about George Floyd, Islam, and diversity at the Oscars sparking widespread criticism. The controversy has quickly overshadowed her awards campaign, drawing significant public and industry scrutiny.In an emotional hour-long interview with CNN en Espanol, Gascon insisted she is not “a racist” as she tearfully addressed her past social media posts. Speaking with interviewer Juan Carlos Arciniegas, she was asked whether she would renounce her historic Oscar nomination—the first ever for an openly transgender actor. Gascon firmly refused, stating, “I cannot renounce a nomination because what I have done is a job, and what is being valued is my acting work,” as translated by The Hollywood Reporter.She further defended her position, saying, “I cannot step down from an Oscar nomination because I have not committed any crime nor have I harmed anyone. I am neither racist nor anything that all these people have tried to make others believe I am.”

Article Title: Microsoft founder Bill Gates: I told Steve Jobs that I see the bullshit, you ...
Article Text:
Bill Gates says Steve Jobs “should have been an actor”

Steve Jobs had “many skills that I didn’t”: Bill Gates

Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates recently shared candid thoughts about his relationship with Steve Jobs Apple , and pivotal moments in tech history during an interview with Axios. The conversation coincides with the release of Gates' new memoir, Source Code, which chronicles the early days of the computer industry.Reflecting on Steve Jobs, Gates called the late Apple co-founder a "singular figure" who had an extraordinary ability to captivate people."He should have been an actor," Gates said. "He really ran the reality distortion field like no one else."Despite Jobs' persuasive charisma, Gates claims he was never under his spell. "I always said to Steve, 'Look, I'm a minor wizard. You're a major wizard. You can cast spells I can't cast, but because I'm a minor wizard, your spells don't work on me. I see the bullshit, that you're just mesmerizing these people.'"Gates recalled a particularly blunt exchange after Jobs unveiled the NeXT computer , a machine that struggled commercially. "This thing is a slow, expensive computer with an overpriced black case," Gates told Jobs at the time.While Gates admired Jobs' "messianic" skills in marketing and leadership, he also noted the late Apple co-founder’s lack of technical expertise. "Steve's achievements are all the more impressive when you know that he couldn't look at a piece of code and know what it was," Gates said. "He was never an engineer. Woz [Steve Wozniak] was a real engineer — I mean, a hardcore engineer."Despite their differing skill sets and approaches, Gates acknowledged that he and Jobs shared one key talent: the ability to inspire their teams. "Clearly, he had so many skills that I didn't, but we were both a little bit pied pipers in terms of getting people to work ridiculous hours," Gates said.The conversation also touched on Microsoft's pivotal role in saving Apple from bankruptcy in 1997, when it invested in the struggling company and pledged support. Gates said he has no regrets about the move. "It was good that Apple recovered and made incredible contributions," he said. "Once you get to the mobile thing, then Apple becomes every bit as important as Microsoft. It wasn't up until then. They were more of a niche."However, Gates admitted that selling Microsoft’s 5% stake in Apple, acquired as part of the deal, was a mistake. "I wish we'd maintained that 5% ownership," he said with a laugh. "It was foolish, foolish to sell it, but when we're worrying about all sorts of antitrust things, we sold it for what now looks like nothing. And we owned part of Facebook for a while, too."
Article Summary: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates recently shared candid thoughts about his relationship with Steve Jobs. The conversation coincides with the release of Gates' new memoir, Source Code. Gates called Jobs a "singular figure" who had an extraordinary ability to captivate people.
